intro: Guatteria araracuarae, commonly known as the Araracuara guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of South America, particularly in regions of Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale green. Its fruit is a smooth, fleshy berry that contains multiple seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species within its native range.
